Our Dorman team is working hard to prepare for tonight’s graduation! Now, let’s just hope the weather cooperates. We plan to decide around 5:00 whether we will need to postpone.

Update from DHS principal Roberson**** Our seniors are very special and have earned the right to be recognized at their graduation. We have been monitoring the weather for tonight closely, and we are moving forward to having our program tonight. We invite our parents and guest to dress comfortable and bring an umbrella or poncho with you in case we have light rain. We have lightening detectors installed at the stadium. In the event the lightening detectors are activated tonight we will have our guests and graduates return to their vehicle and wait safely until we make announcements to safely return to the field to complete the graduation program. We would send the all clear notice on the senior remind and make announcements through the stadium speakers as well. I look forward to celebrating graduation with our seniors tonight!

We have some very sad news to share with our Cavalier family. One of our students, Sahiyd Thomas-Joyner passed away this weekend in a tragic accident. Sahiyd was on a church camping trip Friday at Lake Keowee. According to Sahiyd’s parents, he jumped into the lake to save his brother, who appeared to have been caught in a current. He was able to get his brother to shore, but unfortunately Sahiyd did not make it. Sahiyd was a sophomore who genuinely cared for others. He loved to sing and was actively involved in the Dorman chorus. We ask that you keep his family in your thoughts and prayers. Sahiyd’s siblings also attend District Six schools. His family has created a Gofundme page to help cover the expense of this unexpected tragedy. If you are interested in assisting the family in this way, you may donate through the link below. There will be additional counselors and support available on Monday for students, faculty and staff. We extend our prayers and deepest condolences to Sahiyd’s family.

https://www.gofundme.com/f/sahiyd-thomasjoyner-memorial
